intro: Sinosasa polytricha, commonly known as the Chinese fern, is a species of fern native to East Asia. It belongs to the family Polypodiaceae and is characterized by its delicate, feathery fronds. The plant typically grows in moist, shaded environments such as forests and rocky areas. Its reproductive structures, including sori, are located on the underside of the fronds. Sinosasa polytricha plays a role in maintaining soil stability and supporting local biodiversity.
